goal:
• Ibec is Ireland's national federation of business, industry and employers. It is the largest organisation of its kind in Ireland. Representing businesses of all sizes and across all sectors of the Irish economy, we engage with government, policy makers and key stakeholders at national, EU and global level to shape positive conditions for enterprise, economic growth and employment creation.

• In addition to our public affairs activities, Ibec offers a range of professional services and supports to our member companies.

• There are 42 dedicated sectoral trade associations within Ibec.
interests: Agriculture, Banking and financial services, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Culture and media, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Food Safety, Fraud prevention, General and Institutional Affairs, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: The policy-making activities of the European Institutions are of significant importance to Irish business. As such, Ibec works to protect and promote the profile and interests of Irish business within the Council of the European Union, the European Council, the European Parliament and the European Commission. Our firm position is that the EU Institutions must properly understand and address the needs of the business community in order to ensure the best possible conditions for economic growth, employment creation and community prosperity.
